text: This is the list of the stations on digital television in the Philippines. The availability of channels to viewers depends on their location. The National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) has adopted the ISDB-Tb standard for Philippine television. ==Background== Updated as of . Most channels are still under test broadcast. All analog services are expected to be terminated by the end of 2025. *Data collected from sources and some wiki pages. *Channels received may vary with location or with the strength of the signal of the broadcaster. *Most of the channels are in the phase of test broadcast, resulting to some places that cannot receive other stations due to dead spots and low transmitting power among stations. *Some Channels are encrypted and can only be accessed through select set-top box or mobile dongle manufacturers. ==Metro Manila== ===National Capital Region (NCR)=== Callsign UHF Channel Frequency LCN Broadcaster Short Name Programming Picture Format Broadcasting Hours Notes DWGT-TV 14 473.143 MHz 4.01 People's Television Network PTV HD PTV 16:9 1080i HDTV Weekdays: 5:30 a.m. - 1 a.m. Weekends: 7 a.m. - 1 a.m. Commercial broadcast (10 kW TPO; 25 kW ERP) 4.02 PTV SD 16:9 480i SDTV 4.03 PTV NEWS Radyo Pilipinas 1 6 a.m. - 8 p.m. 4.04 PTV SPORTS PTV Sports Network 8 a.m. – 6 p.m. 4.05 PTV 1SEG PTV 16:9 240p LDTV Weekdays: 5:30 a.m. - midnight Weekends: 7 a.m. - midnight 1seg DZBB-TV 15 479.143 MHz 7.01 GMA Network, Inc.
